Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the role of President Trump in opening the Apple Manufacturing plant in Texas. While he visited the plant and took credit for it, the plant had been operating for six years prior to his visit.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that the opening of the Apple Manufacturing plant will bring high paying jobs back to America. There is no evidence provided to support this assertion.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the opening of the Apple Manufacturing plant is solely due to President Trump's actions. However, it fails to acknowledge that Apple had already been operating in Austin since 1992 and had considered moving operations to China before receiving tariff exemptions.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation for the opening of the Apple Manufacturing plant is the company's long-standing presence in Austin and the recent investments it has made in the city. This suggests that factors beyond President Trump's actions may have influenced the decision to open the plant.
